presentation.1: On December 29, 2015, a core group of six friends got together and founded Chartreuse Gaming, as an association under the law of 1901. Unanimous, they wish to seize the opportunity to take part in the eSport boom by becoming local actors of the rural environment and the Rhône-Alpes region. Thus, they take as their leitmotiv the organization of physical events and online events.
presentation.2: It is only on October 28, 2017, that the first edition of its flagship event is born: the Chartreuse Esport Contest (CEC#1). After encouraging signs, the association wishes to annualize the event and make it grow until obtaining a national influence.
presentation.3: With no less than thirty volunteers and after a period troubled by the health crisis, the association takes the bet of a physical event while the other organizations prefer to dematerialize their event. It was then that Chartreuse Gaming signed its most ambitious event with 98 players spread over League Of Legends, Counter Strike: Global Offensive and Rocket League, and a global prize of 3500€.
presentation.4: This last edition confirms the volunteers in their wish to impose themselves on the regional scene and then on the tricolour scene. In order to achieve this, the association decided to move to Saint-Martin-d'Hères, in the Grenoble metropolis.

1.title: Creation of the association
1.description: December 29, 2015 at the Maison des Associations in Saint Laurent du Pont.

CEC5.presentation: After a pivotal year and a situation in half-tone, the association took the bet to renew its edition under the format of LAN by proposing for the first time three of the most played games on the competitive scene: Counter Strike: Global Offensive, League Of Legends and Rocket League. 98 players answered present on the three games to share a cashprize size XXL, of 3500€!

CEC4.presentation: Due to the health crisis, regulatory and legal measures, the association had no choice but to dematerialize its fourth edition by favoring Rocket League over Counter Strike: Global Offensive and League Of Legends. This edition was entirely distributed by Rocket Baguette and had 32 slots for a cashprize of 450€.

CEC3.presentation: In its momentum, the association decided to diversify its event by offering League Of Legends and Rocket League at the third edition on October 26 and 27, 2019. League Of Legends had a great event with 16 fierce teams, present to share a cashprize of 1000€ while Rocket League had an encouraging start with 11 teams, coming from all over France for a cashprize of 400€.

CGW.presentation: During a winter too long for the taste of some, the association proposed a 2vs2 tournament on Counter Strike: Global Offensive during an evening on January 26, 2019 with a final prize of 200€.

CEC2.presentation: The association renewed its first event and made it its flagship event. This second edition took place on October 20, 2018. This edition welcomed 8 teams, on League Of Legends in 5vs5, for a global cashprize of 400€.

CEC1.presentation: The association organized its first League Of Legends event in 5vs5 on October 28, 2017, with a rather modest ambition. 5 teams responded and the best of them shared the €150 cashprize.
